org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits102941.v131

Class SignatureVerificationException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits102941.v131.ETSITS102941MessagesCaException
          • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.etsits102941.v131.SignatureVerificationException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SignatureVerificationException
extends ETSITS102941MessagesCaException
    Exception thrown if signature couldn't be verified of a ETSITS102941 Messages ca request.

    This is a special category of exceptions used to provide the secret key from the request in CA Messages to encrypt error responses back to the client.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SignatureVerificationException

        public SignatureVerificationException(java.lang.String message,
                                      javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
        Exception thrown if signature couldn't be verified of a ETSITS102941 Messages ca request.
        Parameters:
        message - the detail message. The detail message is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method.
        secretKey - the symmetrical key used to encrypt the response back to the requester. null if no symmetric key could be extracted.

      • SignatureVerificationException

        public SignatureVerificationException(java.lang.String message,
                                      java.lang.Throwable cause,
                                      javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey,
                                      byte[] requestHash)
        Exception thrown if signature couldn't be verified of a ETSITS102941 Messages ca request.
        Parameters:
        message - the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getMessage() method).
        cause - the cause (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)
        secretKey - the symmetrical key used to encrypt the response back to the requester. null if no symmetric key could be extracted.
        requestHash - the hashed value of the request data to identify which request a response is for. Null if not applicable.
